lines.text: I've worked my way up from a common horse thief to a ten-notch man.
She's out like your last match on a windy night. I got to get the doc!
Of all the lug-headed sheriffs I ever saw, you western ones are the dumbest!
Yeah, ain't we, though.
I can't ask men to drive them wagons into certain death!
Some men, Sheriff, aren't worth asking.
lines.character: Dr. Stephen Kellogg, aka Steve Kells

lines.text: And another thing - all horses must be kept off the sidewalks. And last and most important, saloons is to be kept closed between five and six in the morning. You got to sweep 'em out sometime!
Stand back! I ain't gonna have no bloodshed here. I just had the place scrubbed!
Hey, you're a little mite polite for a native. From the east, ain't ya? Which part?
All of me.
lines.character: Dr. Stephen Kellogg, aka Steve Kells

lines.text: Miss Hurricane, where I come from chivalry is not dead.
Well, in this territory they got it gaspin' for breath!
Now Steve, what's on your mind?
The raid on the bank was staged by only a handful of Legion's.
lines.character: Dr. Stephen Kellogg, aka Steve Kells

lines.text: Same bunch that were shootin' up the town?
There scattered all over, but Gulden's the leader of 'em.
lines.character: Dr. Stephen Kellogg, aka Steve Kells

lines.text: What's that name again?
Gullible, Mr. Gullible.
lines.character: Dr. Stephen Kellogg, aka Steve Kells

lines.text: I got it, Thanks.
Mr. Willets I've got first claim on Steve.
He's my prisoner too.
Well, there doesn't seem enough of me to go around. So if you'll both listen, I think I can send enough outlaws your way to divide up even.
lines.character: Dr. Stephen Kellogg, aka Steve Kells

lines.text: Miss Randall, you admit leaving Albany?
Well, as much as I'm in Miles City, yes.
That's proves my point. You came here with the express purpose of meeting Stephen Kellog alias Kells. I trailed ya' step by step.
Ha! You should'a stepped a little faster brother! You ain't caught up with Steve yet! Ha!
I always get my man.
John, Officer Willets is questioning Miss Alice.
Where is he?
If I knew I'd be glad to tell you. So you can take him back to Albany.
Don't expect me to believe that! You're engaged to him.
Well it's true! I want him to stand trial because I know he's innocent.
Ba!
[Turns to Hattie]
Now old lady, I'll take a crack at you.
You do, and I'll take a shot at you! You pucelanitus little popinjay!
Now, Now Hurricane. Don't start'a blowin'.
Sir, do you doubt the words of Honest John Whittaker?
Never heard of him.
